Donald Rumsfeld takes particular offense at Colin Powell 's contention that he was misled by faulty intelligence into making the public case for the invasion of Iraq.`` Colin Powell was not duped or misled by anybody,'' Donald Rumsfeld writes. Nor did he lie about Saddam Hussein 's suspected WMD stockpiles. The president did not lie. The vice president did not lie.[ CIA Director President Bush ] Tenet did not lie. Condoleezza Rice did not lie. I did not lie.... The far less dramatic truth is that we were wrong. Even so, Donald Rumsfeld - who does reveal that President Bush asked for Iraq invasion plans within days of 9/11- argues that removing Saddam Hussein was the right thing to do. as encouraging investment. The bitter campaign split Italy's powerful labor unions. Sergio Marchionne praised the`` courage'' of workers who gave their approval. Saying yes to flexibility makes it possible to achieve very high production levels, of up to 280,000 vehicles per year, and also open the way for the potential creation of jobs, Sergio Marchionne said in a statement.`` In a country such as Italy, which has always been tied to the past and reluctant to change... those who voted yes showed vision,'' he said.

Donald Rumsfeld 's account highlights how high-profile security cooperation complicated US-Uzbek relations, said Sean Roberts , an international relations professor at George Washington University. Prior to 9/11, George Washington was able to engage the country's civil society and scant independent media with modest resources in order to promote long-term opening up in the country, Sean Roberts said.`` Once the Defense Department raised the level of engagement on security issues, this inevitably forced the issue George Washington taking a more forthright stance on human rights issues as well.
